short-title.#text:
GI Bill Tuition Fairness Act of
			 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Approval of courses of
			 education provided by public institutions of higher education for purposes of
			 educational assistance programs administered by Secretary of Veterans Affairs
			 conditional on in-State tuition rate for veterans

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, is amended by adding at the end the following new
			 subsection:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 3679 of title
			 38, United States Code

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
or the Secretary’s designee shall disapprove a course
				of education provided by a public institution of higher education unless the
				institution charges tuition and fees for a veteran at the same rate as the
				institution charges for residents of the State in which the institution is
				located, regardless of the veteran’s State of residence.

text.#text:
Notwithstanding any other provision of this
				subtitle, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall notify the State
				approving agency of the Secretary’s disapproval of a course of education under
				this
				subsection.

, at the time of the initial enrollment of the veteran or
			 eligible person but that is disapproved by the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
chapter 36 of title 38,
			 United States Code

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
or
			 the Secretary’s designee by reason of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
subsection (c) of section 3679 of such
			 title

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: GI Bill Tuition Fairness Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall treat
			 such institution as an institution that is approved under such chapter for
			 purposes of the laws administered by the

with respect to the veteran
			 or eligible person until the veteran or eligible person completes the course of
			 education in which the veteran or eligible person is enrolled.

text.#text:
In the case of a veteran or eligible person who is
			 enrolled before August 1, 2014, in a course of education provided by a public
			 institution of higher education that was approved under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: GI Bill Tuition Fairness Act of 2013/s:2/ss:b/p:2/sp:B

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may not
			 treat an institution of higher education as an approved institution under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: GI Bill Tuition Fairness Act of 2013/s:2/ss:b/p:1
GI Bill Tuition Fairness Act of 2013/s:2/ss:b/p:2/sp:A

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: determines such a waiver is appropriate.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Subsection (c) of
			 section 3679 of title 38, United States Code

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
			 apply with respect to educational assistance provided after August 1,
			 2014.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: GI Bill Tuition Fairness Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a

current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend title 38, United States Code, to require courses
		  of education provided by public institutions of higher education that are
		  approved for purposes of the educational assistance programs administered by
		  the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to charge veterans tuition and fees at the
		  in-State tuition rate, and for other purposes.
